title: Moroccan chicken and couscous salad with sweet potato soup

ingredients.content: Capsicum and sun-dried tomato dip dressing
30 g Parmesan cheese, crust removed and cut into pieces (3 cm)
100 g sun-dried tomatoes or semi sun-dried tomatoes, drained
Â½ red capsicum, deseeded and cut into quarters
Moroccan chicken salad and sweet potato soup
400 g pumpkin, peeled and cut into cubes (1 cm)
520 g chicken breast fillets, cut into cubes (2 cm)
520 g sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into pieces (4-5 cm)
⅛ tsp ground black pepper, to taste
50 g dried cranberries or raisins (approx. 2 tbsp)
6 sprigs fresh mint or fresh coriander, leaves only, finely chopped
400 g canned chickpeas or canned kidney beans, rinsed and drained
7 fresh basil leaves, finely torn, for garnishing

preparations.content: Capsicum and sun-dried tomato dip dressing
Place Parmesan and garlic into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add sun-dried tomatoes, capsicum, cashew nuts, 20 g of the oil and 10 g of the vinegar and chop <b>Turbo/1 sec/5 times<b>, or until a rough yet evenly chopped consistency is achieved. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lemon juice, remaining 50 g of the oil and 10 g of the vinegar and mix <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer dressing into a jug and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Moroccan chicken salad and sweet potato soup

Place Varoma dish into position then weigh pumpkin and chicken into it. Insert Varoma tray, then line with a piece of wet, well-wrung baking paper. Weigh couscous onto Varoma tray, then spread couscous evenly over tray with spatula. Set Varoma aside.
Place coriander into mixing bowl and chop <b>2 sec/speed 7<b>.

Add sweet potato, red lentils, water, stock paste, salt and pepper into mixing bowl. Place a serving bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh spinach and dried cranberries or raisins into it. Set serving bowl aside. Place Varoma into position, secure Varoma lid and cook <b>17 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Arrange apricots, mint or coriander, spring onions/shallots and chickpeas or kidney beans into serving bowl.

Lightly stir pumpkin and chicken with spatula to ensure even cooking, then secure Varoma lid and cook for a further <b>7-8 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, or until chicken is cooked through. Remove Varoma and transfer chicken, pumpkin and couscous into serving bowl with other salad ingredients. Pour over reserved sun-dried tomato dressing and combine.

<b>Insert measuring cup<b> and blend <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>-7, increasing speed gradually from speed 4 to speed 7.<b> Transfer soup into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and adjust seasoning to taste. Garnish soup with basil leaves and serve hot, followed by the salad.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to The Basic Cookbook for the Vegetable stock paste recipe.
